010package imagingbook.common.sift;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.mod;
013import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
014
015import java.util.ArrayList;
016import java.util.Collections;
017import java.util.List;
018
019import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
020import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
021import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
022import imagingbook.common.sift.scalespace.DogScaleSpace;
023import imagingbook.common.sift.scalespace.GaussianScaleSpace;
024import imagingbook.common.sift.scalespace.ScaleLevel;
025import imagingbook.common.sift.scalespace.ScaleOctave;
026import imagingbook.common.util.parameters.DialogParameterBundle;
027
028/**
029 * This class implements the detection of SIFT features from images.
030 * Currently only images of type {@link FloatProcessor} are supported.
031 * 
032 * @author WB
033 * @version 2022/08/03
034 *
035 */
036public class SiftDetector {
037
038        /**
039         * Default parameters; a (usually modified) instance of this class
040         * may be passed to constructor of {@link SiftDetector}.
041         */
042        public static class Parameters implements DialogParameterBundle {       // TODO: add dialog annotations
043                /** Set true to output debug information */
044                public boolean DEBUG = false;
045                /** Type of neigborhood used for peak detection in 3D scale space */
046                public NeighborhoodType3D nhType = NeighborhoodType3D.NH18;
047                /** Sampling scale (nominal smoothing level of the input image) */
048                public double sigmaS = 0.5;
049                /** Base scale of level 0 (base smoothing) */
050                public double sigma0 = 1.6;
051                /** Number of octaves in Gaussian/DoG scale space */
052                public int P = 4;
053                /** Scale steps (levels) per octave */
054                public int Q = 3;
055                /** Min. magnitude required in DoG peak detection (abs. value) */
056                public double tMag = 0.01;
057                /** Min. DoG magnitude required for extrapolated peaks (abs. value) */
058                public double tPeak = tMag;
059                /** Min. difference to all neighbors in DoG peak detection (max. 0.0005) */
060                public double tExtrm = 0.0;
061                /** Max. number of iterations for refining the position of a key point */
062                public int nRefine = 5;
063                /** Max. principal curvature ratio used to eliminate line-like structures (3..10) */
064                public double rhoMax = 10.0;
065                /** Number of orientation bins in the feature descriptor (angular resolution) */
066                public int nOrient = 36;
067                /** Number of smoothing steps applied to the orientation histogram */
068                public int nSmooth = 2;
069                /** Min. value in orientation histogram for dominant orientations (rel. to max. entry) */
070                public double tDomOr = 0.8;
071                /** Spatial size factor of descriptor (relative to feature scale) */
072                public double sDesc = 10.0;
073                /** Number of spatial descriptor bins along each x/y axis */
074                public int nSpat = 4;
075                /** Number of angular descriptor bins */
076                public int nAngl = 8;
077                /** Max. value in normalized feature vector (0.2 recommended by Lowe) */
078                public double tFclip = 0.2;
079                /** Scale factor for converting normalized features to byte values in [0,255] */
080                public double sFscale = 512.0;
081                /** Set true to sort detected keypoints by response magnitude */
082                public boolean sortKeyPoints = true;
083        }
084        
085        private final Parameters params;
086
087        /**
088         * Types of 3D neighborhoods used in min/max detection 
089         */
090        public enum NeighborhoodType3D {
091                NH8(8), NH10(10), NH18(18), NH26(26);
092                private final int size;
093                private NeighborhoodType3D(int size) {
094                        this.size = size;
095                }
096        }
097        
098        static private final double PI2 = 2 * Math.PI;
099
100        /* non-static/final fields */
101
102        private final int nhSize;
103        private final GaussianScaleSpace G;
104        private final DogScaleSpace D;
105
106        /* Constructors */
107
108        /**
109         * Constructor using default parameters.
110         * @param fp the input image
111         */
112        public SiftDetector(FloatProcessor fp) {
113                this(fp, new Parameters());     // uses default parameters
114        }
115
116        /**
117         * Constructor using specific parameters.
118         * @param fp the input image
119         * @param params parameters (see {@link Parameters})
120         */
121        public SiftDetector(FloatProcessor fp, Parameters params) {
122                //normalize(fp);        // was destructive, delegated to ScaleLevel.getValues()
123                this.params = params;
124                this.nhSize = params.nhType.size;
125                this.G = new GaussianScaleSpace(fp, params.sigmaS, params.sigma0, params.P, params.Q, -1, params.Q+1);
126                this.D = new DogScaleSpace(G);
127        }
128
129        /**
130         * Only used for debugging: produces key points with orientation
131         * histograms attached for display purposes.
132         * 
133         * @param keypoints the sequence of original key points
134         * @return a sequence of enhanced key points
135         */
136        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
137        private  List<KeyPoint> makeRichKeypoints(List<KeyPoint> keypoints) {
138//              if (params.DEBUG) {IJ.log("makeSiftDescriptors...");}
139                //int cnt = 0;
140                List<KeyPoint> richKeyPoints = new ArrayList<KeyPoint>();
141                for (KeyPoint kp : keypoints) {
142                        //IJ.log("   " + (cnt++));
143                        float[] oh = getOrientationHistogram(kp);
144                        smoothCircular(oh,params.nSmooth);
145                        kp.orientation_histogram = oh;  // TODO: remove, for testing only!!
146                        List<Double> peakOrientations = findPeakOrientationIndices(oh);
147//                      if (params.DEBUG && peakOrientations.size() == 0) {
148//                              IJ.log("insufficient orientations at " + kp.u + "/" + kp.v);
149//                      }
150                        for (double km : peakOrientations) {
151                                //for (int i=0; i<Math.min(1, peakOrientations.length); i++) {  // use only 1 descriptor!
152                                float phi = (float) (km * 2 * Math.PI / oh.length);     // 0 <= phi < 2 PI. Should be in range +/-PI?
153                                KeyPoint rkp = (KeyPoint) kp.clone();
154                                rkp.orientation = phi;
155                                richKeyPoints.add(rkp);
156                        }
157                }
158//              if (params.DEBUG) {IJ.log("makeSiftDescriptors...done");}
159                return richKeyPoints;
160        }
161
162        /**
163         * Used for debugging/illustrations only!
164         * 
165         * @param oh orientation histogram
166         * @return list of histogram indices for the peak orientations
167         */
168        private List<Double> findPeakOrientationIndices(float[] oh) {
169                int nb = oh.length;
170                List<Double> orientIndexes = new ArrayList<Double>(nb);
171                // find the maximum entry in the orientation histogram 'oh'
172                float maxh = oh[0];
173                for (int k = 1; k < nb; k++) {
174                        if (oh[k] > maxh)
175                                maxh = oh[k];
176                }
177
178                if (maxh > 0.01f) { // ascertain minimum (non-zero) gradient energy
179                        // collect all peaks > 80% of the maximum entry in 'oh'
180                        float minh = maxh * (float) params.tDomOr;
181                        for (int k = 0; k < nb; k++) { // hp ~ hc ~ ha
182                                // angles[k] = Float.NaN;
183                                float hc = oh[k]; // center value
184                                if (oh[k] > minh) { // value is min. 80% of global peak
185                                        float hp = oh[(k - 1 + nb) % nb]; // previous histogram
186                                        // value
187                                        float hn = oh[(k + 1) % nb]; // next histogram value
188                                        if (hc > hp && hc > hn) { // check if 'hc' is a local peak
189                                                // interpolate orientation by a quadratic function
190                                                // (parabola):
191                                                double delta = interpolateQuadratic(hp, hc, hn);
192                                                double k_max = (k + delta + nb) % nb; // interpolated
193                                                // bin index, 0
194                                                // <= km < nPhi
195                                                // double phi_max = k_max * 2 * Math.PI / nb; // 0 <=
196                                                // phi < 2 PI. Should be in range +/-PI?
197                                                orientIndexes.add(k_max);
198                                        }
199                                }
200                        }
201                }
202                return orientIndexes;
203        }
204
205
206        /**
207         * Calculates and returns a list of SIFT descriptors.
208         * 
209         * @return a list of extracted SIFT descriptors
210         */
211        public List<SiftDescriptor> getSiftFeatures() {
212                List<KeyPoint> keyPoints = getKeyPoints();
213                List<SiftDescriptor> siftDescriptors = new ArrayList<SiftDescriptor>();
214                for (KeyPoint c : keyPoints) {
215                        for (double phi_d : getDominantOrientations(c)) {
216                                SiftDescriptor sd = makeSiftDescriptor(c, phi_d);
217                                if (sd != null) {
218                                        siftDescriptors.add(sd);
219                                }
220                        }
221                }
222                return siftDescriptors;
223        }
224
225        private List<KeyPoint> getKeyPoints() {
226                List<KeyPoint> keyPts = new ArrayList<KeyPoint>();
227                final int P = params.P;
228                final int K = params.Q;
229                for (int p = 0; p <= P-1; p++) {        // for every octave p
230                        for (int q = 0; q <= K-1; q++) {        // for every scale level q
231                                List<KeyPoint> extrema = findExtrema(p, q);
232                                for (KeyPoint e : extrema) {
233                                        KeyPoint c = refineKeyPosition(D, e);
234                                        if (c != null) {
235                                                keyPts.add(c);
236                                        }
237                                }
238                        }
239                }
240                if (params.sortKeyPoints) {
241                        Collections.sort(keyPts);
242                }
243                return keyPts;
244        }
245
246        private List<KeyPoint> findExtrema(int p, int q) {
247                final float tMag = (float) params.tMag;
248                final float tExtrm = (float) params.tExtrm;
249                ScaleOctave Dp = D.getOctave(p);
250                ScaleLevel Dpq = D.getScaleLevel(p, q);
251                int M = Dpq.getWidth();
252                int N = Dpq.getHeight();
253                List<KeyPoint> E = new ArrayList<KeyPoint>();
254                float scale = (float) D.getAbsoluteScale(p, q); //D.getScaleIndexFloat(p, q); needed?
255
256                final float[][][] nh = new float[3][3][3];      // 3x3x3 neighborhood [q][u][v]
257                for (int u = 1; u <= M-2; u++) {
258                        float x_real = (float) D.getRealX(p, u);        // for display purposes only
259                        for (int v = 1; v <= N-2; v++) {
260                                float y_real = (float) D.getRealY(p, v);        // for display purposes only
261                                float mag = Math.abs(Dpq.getf(u, v));
262                                if (mag > tMag) {
263                                        Dp.getNeighborhood(q, u, v, nh);        // CHANGE to use D not Dp!!
264                                        if (isExtremum(nh, tExtrm)) {
265                                                KeyPoint e = new KeyPoint(p, q, u, v, u, v, x_real, y_real, scale, mag);
266                                                E.add(e);
267                                        }
268                                }
269                        }
270                }
271                return E;
272        }
273
274        private KeyPoint refineKeyPosition(DogScaleSpace D, KeyPoint k) { 
275                //IJ.log("++Processing " + c.toString());
276                final int p = k.p;
277                final int q = k.q;
278                int u = k.u;
279                int v = k.v;
280                ScaleOctave Dp = D.getOctave(p);
281                //ScaleLevel Dpq = Dp.getLevel(q);
282
283                final double rhoMax = params.rhoMax;
284
285                final float[][][] nh = new float[3][3][3];      // 3x3x3 neighborhood nh[q][u][v]
286                final float[] grad       = new float[3];                // gradient (dx, dy, ds)        
287                final float[] d          = new float[3];                // relocation displacement (dx, dy, ds)
288                final float[][] hess = new float[3][3];         // 3D Hessian matrix:
289                                                                                                        // | dxx dxy dxs |
290                                                                                                        // | dxy dyy dys |
291                                                                                                        // | dxs dys dss |
292                final double tPeak = params.tPeak;
293                final int n_max = params.nRefine;
294
295                final float aMax = (float) (sqr(rhoMax + 1) / rhoMax);
296                KeyPoint kr = null;                                                     // refined keypoint
297                boolean done = false;
298                int n = 1;
299                while (!done && n <= n_max && Dp.isInside(q, u, v)) {
300                        Dp.getNeighborhood(q, u, v, nh);        // TODO: CHANGE to use D instead of Dp!
301                        gradient(nh, grad);                                     // result stored in grad
302                        hessian(nh, hess);                                      // result stored in hess
303                        final double detH = Matrix.determinant3x3(hess);
304                        if (Arithmetic.isZero(detH)) {  // Hessian matrix has zero determinant?
305                                done = true;    // ignore this point and finish
306                        }
307                        else {
308                                final float dxx = hess[0][0];   // extract 2x2 Hessian for calculating curvature ratio below
309                                final float dxy = hess[0][1];
310                                final float dyy = hess[1][1];
311//                              final float[][] invHess = Matrix.inverse3x3(hess);      // deprecated
312                                final float[][] invHess = Matrix.inverse(hess);         // alternative (numerically stable)
313                                Matrix.multiplyD(invHess, grad, d);     // d <-- invHess . grad
314                                Matrix.multiplyD(-1, d);                        // d <-- - d
315                                final float xx = d[0];  // = x'
316                                final float yy = d[1];  // = y'
317
318                                if (Math.abs(xx) < 0.5f && Math.abs(yy) < 0.5f) {       // stay at this lattice point
319                                        done = true;
320                                        final float Dpeak = nh[1][1][1] + 0.5f * (grad[0]*xx + grad[1]*yy + grad[2]*d[2]);
321                                        final float detHxy = dxx * dyy - dxy * dxy;
322                                        if (Math.abs(Dpeak) > tPeak && detHxy > 0) { // check peak magnitude
323                                                final float a = sqr(dxx + dyy) / detHxy;
324                                                if (a <= aMax) {                                        // check curvature ratio (edgeness)
325//                                                      if (params.DEBUG) IJ.log(k.toString() + String.format(": added after %d tries, alpha = %f", n, a));
326                                                        kr = k; //  the passed keypoint is reused for the refined keypoint, with p,q,u,v unchanged
327                                                        kr.x = u + xx;
328                                                        kr.y = v + yy;
329                                                        kr.x_real = (float) D.getRealX(p, kr.x);
330                                                        kr.y_real = (float) D.getRealY(p, kr.y);
331                                                        kr.scale  = (float) D.getAbsoluteScale(p, q);
332                                                }
333                                        }
334                                }
335                                else { // large displacement, move to a neighboring DoG cell at same level q by at most one unit
336                                        u = u + Math.min(1, Math.max(-1, Math.round(xx)));      // move u by max +/-1
337                                        v = v + Math.min(1, Math.max(-1, Math.round(yy)));      // move v by max +/-1
338                                        // Note: we don't move along the scale axis!
339                                }
340                        }
341                        n = n + 1;
342                }
343                return kr;
344        }
345
346        private boolean isExtremum(float[][][] nh, float tExtrm) {
347                return isLocalMin(nh, tExtrm) || isLocalMax(nh, tExtrm);
348        }
349
350        private boolean isLocalMin(final float[][][] neighborhood, float tExtrm) {
351                final float c = neighborhood[1][1][1] + tExtrm; // center value + threshold
352                if (c >= 0) return false;       // local minimum must have a negative value
353                // check 8 neighbors in scale plane q
354                if (c >= neighborhood[1][0][0]) return false;
355                if (c >= neighborhood[1][1][0]) return false;
356                if (c >= neighborhood[1][2][0]) return false;
357                if (c >= neighborhood[1][0][1]) return false;
358                if (c >= neighborhood[1][2][1]) return false;
359                if (c >= neighborhood[1][0][2]) return false;
360                if (c >= neighborhood[1][1][2]) return false;
361                if (c >= neighborhood[1][2][2]) return false;
362                if (nhSize >= 10) {
363                        if (c >= neighborhood[0][1][1]) return false;
364                        if (c >= neighborhood[2][1][1]) return false;
365                        if (nhSize >= 18) {
366                                // check 4 more neighbors in scale plane q-1
367                                if (c >= neighborhood[0][0][1]) return false;
368                                if (c >= neighborhood[0][2][1]) return false;
369                                if (c >= neighborhood[0][1][0]) return false;
370                                if (c >= neighborhood[0][1][2]) return false;
371                                // check 4 more neighbors in scale plane q+1
372                                if (c >= neighborhood[2][0][1]) return false;
373                                if (c >= neighborhood[2][2][1]) return false;
374                                if (c >= neighborhood[2][1][0]) return false;
375                                if (c >= neighborhood[2][1][2]) return false;
376                                // optionally check 8 remaining neighbors (corners of cube):
377                                if (nhSize >= 26) {
378                                        if (c >= neighborhood[0][0][0]) return false;
379                                        if (c >= neighborhood[0][2][0]) return false;
380                                        if (c >= neighborhood[0][0][2]) return false;
381                                        if (c >= neighborhood[0][2][2]) return false;
382                                        if (c >= neighborhood[2][0][0]) return false;
383                                        if (c >= neighborhood[2][2][0]) return false;
384                                        if (c >= neighborhood[2][0][2]) return false;
385                                        if (c >= neighborhood[2][2][2]) return false;
386                                }
387                        }
388                }
389                return true;
390        }
391
392        private boolean isLocalMax(final float[][][] neighborhood, float tExtrm) {
393                final float c = neighborhood[1][1][1] - tExtrm;         // center value - threshold
394                if (c <= 0) return false;       // local maximum must have a positive value
395                // check 8 neighbors in scale plane q
396                if (c <= neighborhood[1][0][0]) return false;
397                if (c <= neighborhood[1][1][0]) return false;
398                if (c <= neighborhood[1][2][0]) return false;
399                if (c <= neighborhood[1][0][1]) return false;
400                if (c <= neighborhood[1][2][1]) return false;
401                if (c <= neighborhood[1][0][2]) return false;
402                if (c <= neighborhood[1][1][2]) return false;
403                if (c <= neighborhood[1][2][2]) return false;
404                if (nhSize >= 10) {
405                        if (c <= neighborhood[0][1][1]) return false;
406                        if (c <= neighborhood[2][1][1]) return false;
407                        if (nhSize >= 18) {
408                                // check 4 more neighbors in scale plane q-1
409                                if (c <= neighborhood[0][0][1]) return false;
410                                if (c <= neighborhood[0][2][1]) return false;
411                                if (c <= neighborhood[0][1][0]) return false;
412                                if (c <= neighborhood[0][1][2]) return false;
413                                // check 4 more neighbors in scale plane q+1
414                                if (c <= neighborhood[2][0][1]) return false;
415                                if (c <= neighborhood[2][2][1]) return false;
416                                if (c <= neighborhood[2][1][0]) return false;
417                                if (c <= neighborhood[2][1][2]) return false;
418                                // optionally check 8 remaining neighbors (corners of cube):
419                                if (nhSize >= 26) {
420                                        if (c <= neighborhood[0][0][0]) return false;
421                                        if (c <= neighborhood[0][2][0]) return false;
422                                        if (c <= neighborhood[0][0][2]) return false;
423                                        if (c <= neighborhood[0][2][2]) return false;
424                                        if (c <= neighborhood[2][0][0]) return false;
425                                        if (c <= neighborhood[2][2][0]) return false;
426                                        if (c <= neighborhood[2][0][2]) return false;
427                                        if (c <= neighborhood[2][2][2]) return false;
428                                }
429                        }
430                }
431                return true;
432        }
433
434        /*
435         * Calculates the 3-dimensional gradient vector for the 3x3x3 neighborhood
436         * nh[s][x][y]. The result is stored in the supplied vector grad, to which a reference is 
437         * returned.
438         */
439        private float[] gradient(final float[][][] nh, final float[] grad) {
440                // Note: factor 0.5f not needed, kept for clarity.
441                grad[0] = 0.5f * (nh[1][2][1] - nh[1][0][1]);   // = dx
442                grad[1] = 0.5f * (nh[1][1][2] - nh[1][1][0]);   // = dy
443                grad[2] = 0.5f * (nh[2][1][1] - nh[0][1][1]);   // = ds
444                return grad;
445        }
446
447        /* 
448         * Calculates the 3x3 Hessian matrix for the 3x3x3 neighborhood nh[s][i][j],
449         * with scale index s and spatial indices i, j.
450         * The result is stored in the supplied array hess, to which a reference is 
451         * returned.
452         */
453        private float[][] hessian(final float[][][] nh, final float[][] hess) {
454                final float nh_111 = 2 * nh[1][1][1];
455                final float dxx = nh[1][0][1] - nh_111 + nh[1][2][1];
456                final float dyy = nh[1][1][0] - nh_111 + nh[1][1][2];
457                final float dss = nh[0][1][1] - nh_111 + nh[2][1][1];
458
459                final float dxy = (nh[1][2][2] - nh[1][0][2] - nh[1][2][0] + nh[1][0][0]) * 0.25f;
460                final float dxs = (nh[2][2][1] - nh[2][0][1] - nh[0][2][1] + nh[0][0][1]) * 0.25f;
461                final float dys = (nh[2][1][2] - nh[2][1][0] - nh[0][1][2] + nh[0][1][0]) * 0.25f;
462
463                hess[0][0] = dxx;  hess[0][1] = dxy;  hess[0][2] = dxs;
464                hess[1][0] = dxy;  hess[1][1] = dyy;  hess[1][2] = dys;
465                hess[2][0] = dxs;  hess[2][1] = dys;  hess[2][2] = dss;
466                return hess;
467        }
468
469        /*
470         * Returns a list of orientations (angles) for the keypoint c.
471         */
472        private List<Double> getDominantOrientations(KeyPoint c) {
473                float[] h_phi = getOrientationHistogram(c);
474                smoothCircular(h_phi, params.nSmooth);
475                return findPeakOrientations(h_phi);
476        }
477
478        // Smoothes the array A in-place (i.e., destructively) in 'iterations' passes.
479        private void smoothCircular(float[] X, int n_iter) {
480                final float[] H = { 0.25f, 0.5f, 0.25f }; // filter kernel
481                final int n = X.length;
482                for (int i = 1; i <= n_iter; i++) {
483                        float s = X[0];
484                        float p = X[n - 1];
485                        for (int j = 0; j <= n - 2; j++) {
486                                float c = X[j];
487                                X[j] = H[0] * p + H[1] * X[j] + H[2] * X[j + 1];
488                                p = c;
489                        }
490                        X[n - 1] = H[0] * p + H[1] * X[n - 1] + H[2] * s;
491                }
492        }
493
494        /* 
495         * Extracts the peaks in the orientation histogram 'h_phi'
496         * and returns the corresponding angles in a (possibly empty) list. 
497         */
498        private List<Double> findPeakOrientations(float[] h_phi) {
499                int n = h_phi.length;
500                List<Double> angles = new ArrayList<Double>(n);
501                // find the maximum entry in the orientation histogram 'h_phi'
502                float h_max = h_phi[0];
503                for (int k = 1; k < n; k++) {
504                        if (h_phi[k] > h_max)
505                                h_max = h_phi[k];
506                }
507                if (h_max > 0.01f) {    // ascertain minimum (non-zero) gradient energy 
508                        // collect all peaks > 80% of the maximum entry in 'oh'
509                        float h_min = h_max * 0.8f;
510                        for (int k = 0; k < n; k++) {   // hp ~ hc ~ ha
511                                float hc = h_phi[k];                                            // center value
512                                if (hc > h_min) {               // value is min. 80% of global peak
513                                        float hp = h_phi[(k - 1 + n) % n];      // previous histogram value
514                                        float hn = h_phi[(k + 1) % n];          // next histogram value
515                                        if (hc > hp && hc > hn) {                       // check if 'hc' is a local peak
516                                                // interpolate orientation by a quadratic function (parabola):
517                                                double delta = interpolateQuadratic(hp, hc, hn);
518                                                double k_max = (k + delta + n) % n;     // interpolated bin index, 0 <= km < nPhi
519                                                double phi_max = k_max * 2 * Math.PI / n;       // 0 <= phi < 2 PI. Should be in range +/-PI?
520                                                angles.add(phi_max);
521                                        }
522                                }
523                        }
524                }
525                return angles;
526        }
527
528        private float[] getOrientationHistogram(KeyPoint c) {
529                final int n_phi = params.nOrient;
530                final int K = params.Q;
531
532                ScaleLevel Gpq = G.getScaleLevel(c.p, c.q);
533                final float[] h_phi = new float[n_phi]; // automatically initialized to zero
534                final int M = Gpq.getWidth(), N = Gpq.getHeight();
535                final double x = c.x, y = c.y;
536
537                final double sigma_w = 1.5 * params.sigma0 * Math.pow(2,(double)c.q/K);
538                final double sigma_w22 = 2 * sigma_w * sigma_w;
539                final double r_w = Math.max(1, 2.5 * sigma_w);
540                final double r_w2 = r_w * r_w;
541
542                final int u_min = Math.max((int)Math.floor(x - r_w), 1);
543                final int u_max = Math.min((int)Math.ceil(x + r_w), M-2);
544                final int v_min = Math.max((int)Math.floor(y - r_w), 1);
545                final int v_max = Math.min((int)Math.ceil(y + r_w), N-2);
546
547                double[] gradPol = new double[2]; // gradient magnitude/orientation
548
549                for (int u = u_min; u <= u_max; u++) {
550                        double dx = u - x;                                      // distance to feature's center
551                        for (int v = v_min; v <= v_max; v++) {
552                                double dy = v - y;
553                                double r2 = dx * dx + dy * dy;  // squared distance from center
554                                if (r2 < r_w2) {                                // inside limiting circle
555                                        Gpq.getGradientPolar(u, v, gradPol);
556                                        double E = gradPol[0], phi = gradPol[1];                                // gradient magnitude/orientation
557                                        double wG = Math.exp(-(dx*dx + dy*dy)/sigma_w22);               // Gaussian weight
558                                        double z = E * wG;
559                                        double k_phi = n_phi * phi / (2 * Math.PI);                             // continuous histogram bin index
560                                        double alpha = k_phi - Math.floor(k_phi);                               // weight alpha
561                                        int k_0 = Math.floorMod((int)Math.floor(k_phi), n_phi); // lower histogram index
562                                        int k_1 = Math.floorMod(k_0 + 1, n_phi);                                                        // upper histogram index
563                                        h_phi[k_0] = (float) (h_phi[k_0] + (1 - alpha) * z);    // distribute z into bins k_0, k_1
564                                        h_phi[k_1] = (float) (h_phi[k_1] + alpha * z);
565                                }
566                        }
567                }
568                return h_phi;
569        }
570
571        private SiftDescriptor makeSiftDescriptor(KeyPoint c, double phi_d) {
572                final int p = c.p, q = c.q;
573                final double x = c.x, y = c.y;
574                final double mag = c.magnitude;
575
576                ScaleLevel Gpq = G.getScaleLevel(p, q);
577                final int M = Gpq.getWidth(), N = Gpq.getHeight(), K = G.getQ();
578
579                double sigma_q = G.getSigma_0() * Math.pow(2, (double) q / K);  // = Gpq.getAbsoluteScale() ?? decimated scale
580                double w_d = params.sDesc * sigma_q;            // descriptor width
581                double sigma_d = 0.25 * w_d;    // width of Gaussian weighting function
582                double sigma_d2 = 2 * sigma_d * sigma_d;
583                double r_d = 2.5 * sigma_d;             // limiting radius
584                double r_d2 = r_d * r_d;                // squared limiting radius
585
586                double sc = 1.0/w_d;                                    // scale to canonical frame
587                double sin_phi_d = Math.sin(-phi_d);    // precalculated sine
588                double cos_phi_d = Math.cos(-phi_d);    // precalculated cosine
589
590                //              Debug(logvar(p,"p") + logvar(q,"q") + logvar(w_d,"w_d"));
591
592                int u_min = Math.max((int)Math.floor(x - r_d), 1);
593                int u_max = Math.min((int)Math.ceil(x + r_d), M - 2);
594                //              Debug(logvar(x,"x") + logvar(u_min,"u_min") + logvar(u_max,"u_max"));
595
596                int v_min = Math.max((int)Math.floor(y - r_d), 1);
597                int v_max = Math.min((int)Math.ceil(y + r_d), N - 2);
598                //              Debug(logvar(y,"y") + logvar(v_min,"v_min") + logvar(v_max,"v_max"));
599
600                // create the 3D orientation histogram, initialize to zero:
601                final int n_Spat = params.nSpat;
602                final int n_Angl = params.nAngl;
603                double[][][] h_grad = new double[n_Spat][n_Spat][n_Angl];
604                double[] gmo = new double[2];   // gradient magnitude/orientation
605
606                for (int u = u_min; u <= u_max; u++) {
607                        double dx = u - x;
608                        for (int v = v_min; v <= v_max; v++) {
609                                double dy = v - y;
610                                double r2 = sqr(dx) + sqr(dy);  // squared distance from center
611                                if (r2 < r_d2) {                                        // inside limiting circle
612                                        // map to the canonical coordinate frame, ii,jj \in [-1/2, +1/2]:
613                                        double uu = sc * (cos_phi_d * dx - sin_phi_d * dy);
614                                        double vv = sc * (sin_phi_d * dx + cos_phi_d * dy);
615                                        // calculate the gradient of Gaussian scale level (p,q) at position (u,v):
616                                        Gpq.getGradientPolar(u, v, gmo);
617                                        double E = gmo[0];                      // gradient magnitude
618                                        double phi = gmo[1];            // gradient orientation
619                                        double phi_norm = mod(phi - phi_d, PI2);// normalized gradient orientation      
620                                        double w_G = Math.exp(-r2/sigma_d2);    // Gaussian weight
621                                        double z = E * w_G;                                             // quantity to accumulate
622                                        updateGradientHistogram(h_grad, uu, vv, phi_norm, z);
623                                }
624                        }
625                }
626                int[] f_int = makeFeatureVector(h_grad);
627                double sigma_pq = G.getAbsoluteScale(p, q);
628                double x_real = G.getRealX(p, x);
629                double y_real = G.getRealY(p, y);
630                return new SiftDescriptor(x_real, y_real, sigma_pq, p, mag, phi_d, f_int);
631        }
632
633        private void updateGradientHistogram(double[][][] h_grad, double uu, double vv, double phi_norm, double z) {
634                final int n_Spat = params.nSpat;
635                final int n_Angl = params.nAngl;
636
637                final double ii = n_Spat * uu + 0.5 * (n_Spat - 1);     // continuous spatial histogram index i'
638                final double jj = n_Spat * vv + 0.5 * (n_Spat - 1);     // continuous spatial histogram index j'
639                final double kk = phi_norm * (n_Angl / PI2);            // continuous orientation histogram index k'
640
641                final int i0 = (int) Math.floor(ii);
642                final int i1 = i0 + 1;
643                
644                final int j0 = (int) Math.floor(jj);
645                final int j1 = j0 + 1;
646                
647                final int k0 = Math.floorMod((int) Math.floor(kk), n_Angl);
648                final int k1 = (k0 + 1) % n_Angl;                       // k0 >= 0
649                
650                final double alpha0 = 1.0 - (ii - i0);
651                final double alpha1 = 1.0 - alpha0;
652
653                final double beta0 = 1.0 - (jj - j0);
654                final double beta1 = 1.0 - beta0;
655
656                final double gamma0 = 1.0 - (kk - Math.floor(kk));
657                final double gamma1 = 1.0 - gamma0;
658
659                final int[] I = {i0, i1};       // index arrays used in loops below
660                final int[] J = {j0, j1};
661                final int[] K = {k0, k1};
662
663                final double[] A = {alpha0, alpha1};
664                final double[] B = {beta0, beta1};
665                final double[] C = {gamma0, gamma1};
666
667                // distribute z over 8 adjacent spatial/angular bins:
668                for (int a = 0; a <= 1; a++) {
669                        int i = I[a];
670                        if (i >= 0 && i < n_Spat) {
671                                double wa = A[a];
672                                for (int b = 0; b <= 1; b++) {
673                                        int j = J[b];
674                                        if (j >= 0 && j < n_Spat) {
675                                                double wb = B[b];
676                                                for (int c = 0; c <= 1; c++) {
677                                                        int k = K[c];
678                                                        double wc = C[c];
679                                                        h_grad[i][j][k] = h_grad[i][j][k] + z * wa * wb * wc;
680
681                                                }
682                                        }
683                                }
684                        }
685                }
686        }
687
688        private int[] makeFeatureVector(double[][][] h_grad) {
689                final int n_Spat = params.nSpat;
690                final int n_Angl = params.nAngl;
691                float[] f = new float[n_Spat * n_Spat * n_Angl];
692                // flatten 3D histogram to a 1D vector
693                // the histogram is vectorized such that k (phi) is the fastest
694                // varying index, followed by j and i (which is the slowest index).
695                // Note: j (v) is the slowest in VLFEAT (i,j swapped)
696                int m = 0;
697                for (int i = 0; i < n_Spat; i++) {
698                        for (int j = 0; j < n_Spat; j++) {
699                                for (int k = 0; k < n_Angl; k++) {
700                                        f[m] = (float) h_grad[i][j][k];
701                                        m = m + 1;
702                                }
703                        }
704                }
705                normalize(f);
706                clipPeaks(f, (float) params.tFclip);    
707                normalize(f);
708                return mapToIntegers(f, (float) params.sFscale);
709        }
710
711        private void normalize(float[] x) {
712                final double norm = Matrix.normL2(x);
713                if (norm > Arithmetic.EPSILON_FLOAT) {
714                        final float s = (float) (1.0 / norm);
715                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
716                                x[i] = s * x[i];
717                        }
718                }
719        }
720
721        private void clipPeaks(float[] x, float xmax) {
722                for (int i=0; i<x.length; i++) {
723                        if (x[i] > xmax) {
724                                x[i] = xmax;
725                        }
726                }
727        }
728
729        private int[] mapToIntegers(float[] x, float s) {
730                int[] ivec = new int[x.length];
731                for (int i=0; i<x.length; i++) {
732                        ivec[i] = Math.round(s * x[i]);
733                }
734                return ivec;
735        }
736
737        //  auxiliary methods -------------------------
738
739        /*
740         * Calculate the extremal position from 3 discrete function values 
741         * at x = -1, 0, +1: f(-1) = 'y1', f(0) = 'y2', f(+1) = 'y3'.
742         */
743        private float interpolateQuadratic(float y1, float y2, float y3) {
744                float a = (y1 - 2*y2 + y3) / 2;
745                if (Math.abs(a) < 0.00001f) {
746                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("quadratic interpolation failed " 
747                                        + a + " " + y1 + " " + y2 + " " + y3);
748                }
749                float b = (y3 - y1) / 2;
750//              float c = y2;
751                float x_extrm = -b / (2*a);             // extremal position
752//              float y_extrm = a*x*x + b*x + c;        // extremal value (not needed)
753                return x_extrm; // x is in [-1,+1]
754        }
